title: How to Make a Lampshade Using Bonnet Hats

steps.headline: Collect all of the items to be used.
Center the socket on top of the figurine.
Secure the socket using electrical tape.
Cut out the entire bottom of the first disposable cup.
steps.description: Do this with a knife. The hole should be large enough to fit around the lamp socket

steps.headline: Fit this bottomless cup over the top of the figurine and socket
Screw the bulb into the socket.
Using a second disposable cup, cut it across at its approximate center.
steps.description: Use the top of the cup. Dispose of the bottom section.

steps.headline: Remove the entire bottom of the gallon plastic container (the container should be a size that your hat will fit over).
Attach the upper part of the second cup (that you cut horizontally) inside the gallon container.
steps.description: Secure it with the transparent tape, taking care to center it.

steps.headline: Place the gallon container over the top of your figurine.
steps.description: Be sure to keep the bulb centered in the gallon container body.

steps.headline: Cover the gallon container with the bonnet hat.
Plug it in and turn it on to see your new lamp!

text: Collect all of the items to be used.  Center the socket on top of the figurine.  Secure the socket using electrical tape.  Cut out the entire bottom of the first disposable cup. Do this with a knife. The hole should be large enough to fit around the lamp socket Fit this bottomless cup over the top of the figurine and socket  Screw the bulb into the socket.  Using a second disposable cup, cut it across at its approximate center. Use the top of the cup. Dispose of the bottom section. Remove the entire bottom of the gallon plastic container (the container should be a size that your hat will fit over).  Attach the upper part of the second cup (that you cut horizontally) inside the gallon container. Secure it with the transparent tape, taking care to center it. Place the gallon container over the top of your figurine. Be sure to keep the bulb centered in the gallon container body. Cover the gallon container with the bonnet hat.  Arrange it neatly.  Plug it in and turn it on to see your new lamp!
